results.title: Healthy Lunch – Fruit and Tuna Lettuce Wrap with Ocean Naturals #shop #OceanNaturals #cbias

steps.step: In a small bowl, mix together the citrus vinaigrette with the greek yogurt.
Mix well and set aside.Chop all your fruits.In a medium size bowl, toss the tuna with the avocado, mango, oranges and strawberries.
Add the Citrus Greek Yogurt. Toss to coat.
Lay out a large leaf of Romaine
Lettuce. Spoon the mixture in the middle and roll like a tortilla.Eat and Enjoy!

ingredients.name: greek yogurt
ingredients.original: ¼ cup of original or greek yogurt
ingredients.originalString: ¼ cup of original or greek yogurt

ingredients.name: mango
ingredients.original: ½ cup of mango slices, chopped
ingredients.originalString: ½ cup of mango slices, chopped

ingredients.name: tuna
ingredients.original: 1 Can of Ocean Naturals Tuna, drained
ingredients.originalString: 1 Can of Ocean Naturals Tuna, drained

ingredients.name: vinaigrette
ingredients.original: 2 Tbs. Citrus Vinaigrette (I bought some in the dressing aisle at the store)
ingredients.originalString: 2 Tbs. Citrus Vinaigrette (I bought some in the dressing aisle at the store)
ingredients.originalName: Citrus Vinaigrette (I bought some in the dressing aisle at the store)

steps.step: Add all of the ingredients to a high speed blender and blend until smooth! It's that easy. ;)

results.title: Strawberry Spinach Salad with Basil,Toasted Pecans, and Sugar Snap Peas {and a Cookbook Give-away!}

steps.step: In a medium bowl, toss the spinach and strawberries.In small bowl, whisk together the oil, vinegar, sugar, paprika, sesame seeds, and poppy seeds.
Pour over the spinach and strawberries, and toss to coat.

results.title: Grilled Balsamic Chicken and Strawberry Salad

steps.step: Pour 1/4 cup dressing over the chicken, turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.Prep grill for indirect heat and heat grill to 350 degrees. Cook chicken 7 - 8 minutes per side or until meat thermometer inserted registers 165 degrees.
Remove and allow to rest 5 minutes before slicing.While the chicken is resting place baby greens, goat cheese, pistachios and sliced strawberries in a large bowl.
Pour remaining 1/4 cup of dressing over the salad. Toss to coat.
Place sliced chicken on top of salad and serve.

ingredients.name: vinaigrette dressing
ingredients.original: 1/2 cup Kraft Balsamic Vinaigrette Dressing, divided
ingredients.originalString: 1/2 cup Kraft Balsamic Vinaigrette Dressing, divided

ingredients.name: vinaigrette dressing
ingredients.original: 1/2 cup Kraft Balsamic Vinaigrette Dressing, divided

results.title: Grilled Beef with Spinach and Strawberry Salad

steps.step: In large nonmetal dish or resealable food-storage plastic bag, place steak.
Add 1/4 cup of the vinaigrette dressing; turn to coat. Cover dish or seal bag; refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight to marinate.
When ready to grill, heat gas or charcoal grill. When grill is heated, remove steak from marinade; discard marinade.
Place steak on gas grill over medium heat or on charcoal grill over medium coals; cover grill. Cook 10 to 12 minutes, turning once, until desired doneness.
Cut steak diagonally across grain into thin slices.
In large bowl, toss spinach, strawberries, onions and remaining 1/2 cup vinaigrette dressing to mix.
Divide spinach mixture evenly onto serving plates. Top each with steak slices; sprinkle with almonds.

steps.step: In large nonmetal dish or resealable food-storage plastic bag, place steak.
Add 1/4 cup of the vinaigrette dressing; turn to coat. Cover dish or seal bag; refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight to marinate.
When ready to grill, heat gas or charcoal grill. When grill is heated, remove steak from marinade; discard marinade.
Place steak on gas grill over medium heat or on charcoal grill over medium coals; cover grill. Cook 10 to 12 minutes, turning once, until desired doneness.
Cut steak diagonally across grain into thin slices.
In large bowl, toss spinach, strawberries, onions and remaining 1/2 cup vinaigrette dressing to mix.
